reviews.review_msg: He's obviously intelligent, although his intellectual capacity is not usally demonstrated at a particularly high level in class lectures. He takes a very long time to get to obvious conclusions, though this may be for some pedagogical reason unknown to me. I find him strange, and a little awkward, I prefer to approach him in email vs.in person.

Great guy! Has a laid-back style that is welcomed. Lectures are not the most well-organised but insights are all there and he eventually gets thing across clearly.  Does well at facilitating debate; not afraid to discuss things outside of class content which is great; I like the personal anecdotes...Resembles Christian Bale to a certain extent...

I really do enjoy his class. I find his insights to be interesting, he facilitates interesting discussions, and the readings he assigns are informative and insightful. Being a Poli Sci major, I've had my fill of AWFUL profs, I must say that this man is a nice change of pace!

courseware articles 'grounded' the course. not expected to read them too diligently but if you did, he would be willing to entertain your questions and ideas.  so course is hospitable to all:  not too demanding, also marking not too hard, yet if you're interested you can get much out of it.
Decent enough guy. But dude can't write shyt. I still cannot read what he wrote on my paper.
A very good professor. He is extremely helpful and informative.

The course was blended as lecture were online and tutorial was in person. Dr. Heard was very accommodating during the term for my circumstances. His response time was fast. The lectures were informative, engaging and interesting. Assignments and exams were fair. I highly recommend.

He reminds me of Tigger. He is so friendly and makes learning about constitutional law very entertaining and easy to understand, which is impressive given the complexity of Canadian federalism and constitutional interpretation. Graded fairly, recorded lectures, but messed up both our midterm and final, so that was slightly frustrating.

Hilarious guy who manages to make the Canadian Constitution/politics fun. Definitely knows his stuff. Provides thorough lecture notes and lectures well enough that you can fill them in more and not need the readings at all (I didn't even buy the books). Paper is long but manageable.
Probably one of the most pleasant person you will ever meet. Manages to make super dry content enjoyable. Also really appreciate that he records lecture

He is able to make the Canadian constitution incredibly interesting given how dry the content is. Dr. Heard takes the time to make the content understandable by providing many examples that can even be used on exams. He really took the time to reconstruct this course and he did an excellent job.

Andy Heard is a great professor, he does his best to make dry course material interesting. He also records his lectures and posts them to canvas which is extremely helpful when studying! He really cares about his students, 10/10 would recommend.
He's a wonderful professor but he pushes you, so be serious about the material and make sure you analyze your readings before you even think of coming to class.  AND you MUST come to class.
Nice, reasonable guy who's got teaching down to an artform. Very paritcular on papers so make sure yuo get someone to look over your paper for mistakes. Fair marker, and recommended overall.
